notes: The spelling of Tiwanaku has varied significantly since the Spanish first discovered the ruins in the sixteenth century. Spanish chroniclers used Tiaguanco. Early republican antiquarians and travel accounts use Tiahuanacu, Tiahuanaco, or Tihuanacu. In accordance with modern standards of written Aymara and recent archeological research, I use Tiwanaku.
